column1: Former Obama adviser pleads guilty to stealing $218K from schools
column2: "Fox News Flash top entertainment and celebrity headlines are here. Check out what clicked this week in entertainment.//Fox News Flash top entertainment and celebrity headlines are here. Check out what clicked this week in entertainment.//A former Obama administration adviser pleaded guilty to wire fraud and stealing $218
column3: 000 from charter schools
column4: announced the Southern District of New York (SDNY) on Friday.//"Seth Andrew
column5: a former White House advisor
column6: admitted today to devising a scheme to steal from the very same schools he helped create. Andrew now faces time in federal prison for abusing his position and robbing those he promised to help
column7:
said U.S. Attorney Damian Williams on Friday.   //FORMER OBAMA OFFICIAL CHARGED WITH STEALING $218,000 FROM SCHOOLS//
      Former President Barack Obama speaks at a rally to support Michigan democratic candidates at Detroit Cass Tech High School on Oct. 26, 2018 in Detroit, Michigan. 
      (Bill Pugliano/Getty Images)//According to the Department of Justice, in 2005, Andrew created School Network-1
column8: a series of New York-based charter schools. In 2013, Andrew left his position at the school and took a role in the Department of Education. He later became a senior adviser in the White House's Office of Educational Technology.//In 2019, Andrew closed three escrow accounts that, pursuant to the charter agreement, were only to be shut down in the case that the schools dissolved, and funds could not be moved by Andrew
column11:
according to SDNY.//
      This undated photo provided by the U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, shows Damian Williams.
      (Courtesy of U.S. Attorney's Office via AP)//He then deposited the money from two of the closed escrow accounts into a new business bank account. According to DOJ, in order to open the new business account, he misrepresented to a bank employee that he was a 'Key Executive with Control of' School Network-1 Charter School and supported that misrepresentation with emails."//In addition
column12: he deposited the third escrow account funds into an account that he opened at another bank. //

column1: Sign Robert F Kennedy Justice Department Building Pennsylvania Avenue Washington DC Completed in 1935. Houses 1000s of lawyers working at Justice.
(iStock)//All the deposits of the stolen money were eventually transferred into an account under Andrew’s complete control
column2: amounting to more than $200
column3: 000.//"I am truly sorry for what I have done
column4: said Andrew on Friday before Judge John P. Cronan. What I did was wrong and I deeply regret my actions. And
column5: as I stand before you today
column6: I have tremendous remorse for the impact it has had on the schools
column7: the alumni and my own family."//CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP//Andrew has agreed to pay $218
column8: 000 in restitution to the Charter School Network.//He is scheduled to be sentenced before Judge Cronan on April 14
column9: 2022. The charge carries a maximum sentence of 20 years in prison.//The Associated Press contributed to this report."

column1: Former Obama-era acting DHS inspector general pleads guilty to scheme to steal gov’t software
column2: "Fox News Flash top headlines are here. Check out what's clicking on Foxnews.com.//Fox News Flash top headlines are here. Check out what's clicking on Foxnews.com.//The former acting head of the Office of Inspector General for the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) has pleaded guilty to charges related to a scheme to steal confidential software from the government
column3: the Justice Department announced Friday.//Charles Edwards
column4: who worked as acting inspector general at DHS-OIG between 2011 and 2013
column5: is accused of having executed a scheme to steal confidential and proprietary software from the government after he left the agency and set up his own company.//DHS OIG FINDS VISA PROGRAM FOR CRIME VICTIMS MARRED BY FRAUD MISMANAGEMENT //

column1: U.S. Secret Service Director Mark Sullivan
column2: left
column3: and Department of Homeland Security's acting Inspector General Charles K. Edwards
column4: testify on Capitol Hill in Washington
column5: Wednesday
column6: May 23
column8: before the Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee. (AP Photo/Charles Dharapak)

column1: (AP Photo/Charles Dharapak)//The government accused him of stealing software from the office
column2: including government databases that contained personal information of DHS and U.S. Postal Service (USPS) employees
column3: "so that his company could develop a commercially-owned version of a case management system to be offered for sale to government agencies." Edwards has set up Delta Business Solutions in Maryland and was accused of stealing software between 2015 and 2017.//Before serving at DHS-OIG
column4: he had worked as the USPS Office of Inspector General
column5: and had access to software systems at both agencies
column6: including those used for case management and sensitive personal databases. He resigned from the DHS OIG in 2013 amid a Senate investigation into his whether he had delayed investigations and softened reports
column7: claims he denied. The Washington Post reported that he was accused of having pushed to changed findings in reports to keep them from embarrassing the Obama administration. He was also accused of retaliation against staff who resisted him.//The Justice Department said that Edwards pleaded guilty to conspiracy to commit theft of government property and theft of government property. A second defendant has pleaded not guilty
column8: and his case is ongoing.//CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP//In 2020
column10: DOJ said he stole the software so that he could sell an enhanced version to the U.S. Department of Agriculture. It was also alleged that he and the second defendant
column12: reconfigured Edwards’ laptop to upload the stolen software and had built a testing server at his residence with the software and database. //Edwards was also accused of having retained software developers in India for the purpose of making the alternative software."

column1: Obama about-faces on filibuster to push election bills, gives full support to Biden to ‘modify Senate rules’
column2: "In media news today
column3: Associated Press tells staff to ‘avoid emphasizing COVID case counts
column4: the Economic Council director urges the media to focus on wage increases instead of inflation
column5: and the mainstream media drags Rand Paul for clashing with Dr. Fauci.//In media news today
column6: Associated Press tells staff to ‘avoid emphasizing COVID case counts
column7: the Economic Council director urges the media to focus on wage increases instead of inflation
column8: and the mainstream media drags Rand Paul for clashing with Dr. Fauci.//Former President Obama authored an op-ed in USA Today Wednesday that
column10: contradicts his previous take on the filibuster in the Senate.//As the Democrats attempt to pass their expansive voting overhaul bills through Congress
column11: Republicans are being accused of holding up the line. The former president argued that for this reason
column12: Democrats should clear President Biden's path and end the filibuster
column13: which creates a 60-vote threshold to advance legislation.//"The filibuster has no basis in the Constitution
column15: the parliamentary tactic was used sparingly – most notably by Southern senators to block civil rights legislation and prop up Jim Crow. In recent years
column16: the filibuster became a routine way for the Senate minority to block important progress on issues supported by the majority of voters. But we can’t allow it to be used to block efforts to protect our democracy."//KEVIN MCCARTHY: DEMOCRATS' ELECTION BILL IS ABOUT ‘GAMING THE SYSTEM

column1: Former President Barack Obama speaks at a rally to support Michigan Democratic candidates at Detroit Cass Tech High School on Oct. 26
column2: 2018 in Detroit
column3: Michigan. (Bill Pugliano/Getty Images)

column1: //"That’s why I fully support President Joe Biden’s call to modify Senate rules as necessary to make sure pending voting rights legislation gets called for a vote
column2: he continued. And every American who cares about the survival of our most cherished institutions should support the president’s call as well."//But Obama didn’t always find the filibuster to be an outdated tactic. In 2005
column3: then-Sen. Obama of Illinois fought against ending the filibuster
column4: arguing that Americans don’t expect political parties to "change the rules in the middle of the game so that they can make all the decisions while the other party is told to sit down and keep quiet." At the time
column5: Republican President George W. Bush was in the White House and Republicans held unified control of Congress.//

column1: Vice President Joseph Biden and House Speaker Nancy Pelosi applaud President Barack Obama during his State of the Union address on Jan. 27
column3: in Washington. (Toni L. Sandys/The Washington Post via Getty Images)

column1: //"If the majority chooses to end the filibuster
column2: if they choose to change the rules and put an end to Democratic debate
column3: then the fighting and the bitterness and the gridlock will only get worse
column4: he said.//Obama opened his op-ed with mention of the late Rep. John Lewis, D-Ga., whom he had given a eulogy for in July 2020. The eulogy suggested eliminating the filibuster as another Jim Crow relic." //Following Lewis’ mantra that democracy isn’t a given
column5: Obama stressed in the op-ed that the American people must "vigilantly preserve and protect our most basic tool of self-government
column6: which is the right to vote."//

column1: President Barack Obama presents the Presidential Medal of Freedom to U.S. Rep. John Lewis
column2: D-Ga.
column3: during a ceremony in the East Room of the White House on Feb. 15
column4: 2011. (AP Photo/Carolyn Kaster
column5: File)

column1: //"Now is the time for all of us to follow John Lewis' example. Now is the time for the U.S. Senate to do the right thing
column2: he said. America’s long-standing grand experiment in democracy is being sorely tested. Future generations are counting on us to meet that test."//CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP"

column1: Biden, Obama pay tribute to late Sen. Harry Reid
column2: "Fox News Flash top headlines are here. Check out what's clicking on Foxnews.com.//Fox News Flash top headlines are here. Check out what's clicking on Foxnews.com.//Former President Barack Obama remembered former Sen. Harry Reid
column3: D-Nev.
column4: as a dogged fighter who defied the odds to become one of the most powerful and successful politicians in America. //"And let's face it
column5: he enjoyed every minute of proving doubters wrong again and again and again
column6:
Obama said in a eulogy for Reid on Saturday. //Reid, Nevada's longest-serving member of Congress who rose to serve as Senate majority leader, died Dec. 28, 2021, at the age of 82. He battled pancreatic cancer. //Reid was honored by his children, Obama and President Biden at his memorial service in Las Vegas as a dedicated family man and accomplished lawmaker.//
      President Joe Biden speaks during a memorial service for former Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid at the Smith Center in Las Vegas, Saturday, Jan. 8, 2022. (AP Photo/Susan Walsh)
      (AP Photo/Susan Walsh)//Born in Searchlight, Nevada, to an alcoholic father who killed himself at 58 and a mother who served as a laundress in a bordello, Reid grew up in a small cabin without indoor plumbing and swam with other children at a pool at a local brothel. He hitchhiked to Basic High School in Henderson, Nevada, 40 miles from home, where he met the wife he would marry in 1959, Landra Gould. //Harry Reid will be considered one of the greatest Senate Majority Leaders in history
column7: Biden said. //HARRY REID, FORMER SENATE MAJORITY LEADER, DEAD AT 82//Reid didn't own a tuxedo and wasn't a fan of the trappings of Washington parties and fundraisers, according to speakers, but he was guided by the well-being of his fellow Americans.//It was all Searchlight
column9: Biden said of Reid. //Obama said Reid was very generous to him as a young senator from Illinois and was one of the first people to encourage him to run for president. Obama said Reid was a man of old school virtues" who was a fighter throughout his presidency to pass his agenda
column10: including the Affordable Care Act. //"It's a debt to him that I could never fully repay
column11: Obama said.//Obama then contradicted House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's comments that she didn't hear Reid speak ill of his colleagues. //I don't know about that
column13: Obama said to laughs. //Still, Obama said Reid was pragmatic and would work with those he didn't like.//In a battle between perfection and progress
column16: Obama added.//Reid was in Congress from 1983 until his retirement in 2017.  He served as Senate majority leader from 2007 to 2015.//Reid became most well-known for his use of the nuclear option" in 2013
column17: leading the charge to end the filibuster on executive branch nominees and judicial nominees other than to the Supreme Court.//

column1: President Joe Biden
column2: first lady Jill Biden
column3: Vice President Kamala Harris and her husband Doug Emhoff attend a memorial service for former Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid at the Smith Center in Las Vegas
column4: Saturday
column5: Jan. 8

column1: (AP Photo/Susan Walsh)//Reid initially broke into elected office in 1969
column2: serving in the Nevada Assembly until 1971. He then served as lieutenant governor of Nevada from 1971-1975 before being elected to serve Nevada's first district in the U.S. House of Representatives in 1982. He was first elected to the Senate in 1987.//HARRY REID CALLS ELIZABETH WARREN A 'GOOD PERSON
column3: ' BUT REFUSES TO ENDORSE HER FOR PRESIDENT//The Nevada lawmaker consistently bucked his own party on the issue of Roe v. Wade
column4: which he believed should be overturned. A fierce advocate of conservation
column5: he helped spearhead designating nearly 5.1 million acres of Nevada land as federally protected.//Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer
column6: D-N.Y.
column7: considered Reid his mentor and said his friend was "tough as nails" and a "fighter to his core." //But he also shared stories of levity
column8: including Reid slipping him $400 in cash so Schumer could buy better shoes and Reid being so excited about Democrats retaking the Senate in 2006 he kissed Claire McCaskill through the TV screen as election returns came in showing she won the Senate seat in Missouri.//"His lips remained attached to the TV screen for a full 10 seconds
column9: Schumer quipped. He kissed Claire's image so passionately
column10: I had to get up and wipe the copious spittle off the TV screen."//

column2: D-Nev.
column3: right
column4: hugs incoming Senate Minority Leader Charles Schumer
column5: D-N.Y.
column6: during Reid's portrait unveiling ceremony in Russell Building's Kennedy Caucus Room
column7: December 08

column1: (Tom Williams/CQ Roll Call)//Reid played a central role in helping push the agenda of former President Barack Obama
column2: leading the charge to unify all 60 members of the Democratic caucus in support of the Affordable Care Act in 2009.//Despite widespread backlash to that law during the 2010 midterm elections
column3: Reid defeated Tea Party favorite Sharron Angle by six points as other Republicans won a landslide election to retake the House.//Reid’s wisp-thin voice betrayed his steely exterior. A combative former boxer
column4: Reid was a tough dealmaker with an abrupt style. He was remembered for his habit of hanging up the phone on people without saying goodbye. //"I immodestly say that I probably got hung up on the most by Harry Reid
column5: two or three times a day for 12 years
column6: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., said at the funeral.//Biden apparently wasn't immune to the hang-ups either. //Every time I hear a dial tone I think of Harry
column7:
Biden said.  //
      Former President Barack Obama speaks during a memorial service for former Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid at the Smith Center in Las Vegas, Saturday, Jan. 8, 2022. 
      (AP Photo/John Locher)//Biden praised Reid for his loyalty, faith, and keeping his word. //Harry would always have your back
column8: Biden said. //In 2012, Reid caught heat for falsely accusing then-presidential candidate Mitt Romney of not paying taxes for 10 years. He made the claim on the floor of the Senate and showed no remorse for it, telling the Washington Post in 2016 it was one of the best things I’ve ever done" because Obama beat Romney in the election.  //CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP//Reid was the third of four sons. He attended Southern Utah University before graduating from Utah State University in 1961
column9: where he double-majored in political science and history. From there he attended George Washington University Law School
column10: working as a Capitol Police officer while simultaneously earning his J.D. degree in 1964.//He is survived by his wife
column12: and five children.//Reid will lie in state in the U.S. Capitol Rotunda on Jan. 12.//Fox News' Chad Pergram and Michael Lee contributed to this report as well as the Associated Press. "

column1: Manchin pressured to back filibuster changes by Clinton, Obama, Oprah
column2: "The former House speaker discusses Mitch McConnell signaling openness to election reform and Vice President Kamala Harris laughing off questions about office turmoil. //The former House speaker discusses Mitch McConnell signaling openness to election reform and Vice President Kamala Harris laughing off questions about office turmoil. //West Virginia Sen. Joe Manchin is getting pressure from powerful corners of the Democratic Party to change his stance on the Senate filibuster to pass voting reforms. //In addition to regular talks with Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer
column3: D-N.Y.
column4: and other fellow Democratic senators
column5: Manchin has heard from past presidents and celebrities alike.//SCHUMER ADMITS FILIBUSTER VOTE IS 'UPHILL' CLIMB AMID ONGOING 'PRIVATE' TALKS WITH MANCHIN
column6: SINEMA//He's told colleagues that his phone has been lighting up in recent days with calls from former Presidents Bill Clinton and Barack Obama and legendary TV host Oprah Winfrey
column7: Politico reported.//They are lobbying him to vote in favor of removing the 60-vote Senate rule to pass major voting rights reforms with a simple majority. //

Schumer wants an exception made for election legislation
column4: arguing there's an urgent need for national standards to combat "voter suppression" laws passed in GOP-led states after the 2020 presidential election. //So far

column6: Manchin told reporters Tuesday: "Anytime there's a carve out
column7: you eat the whole turkey.""

column1: California man had rifle, TikTok 'hit list' naming Biden, former presidents on way to White House, feds say
column2: "Former Reagan economic adviser Art Laffer explains how Biden should deal with Build Back Better on ‘Your World.’//Former Reagan economic adviser Art Laffer explains how Biden should deal with Build Back Better on ‘Your World.’//A recently fired California grocery store worker was arrested in Iowa last week after he was found with a TikTok "hit list" filled with the of names of political and public figures
column3: including President Biden
column4: former presidents Bill Clinton and Barack Obama
column5: Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg and Dr. Anthony Fauci
column6: in a haphazard plan to "combat evil demons in the White House
column7:
according to court records. //Kuachua Brillion Xiong, 25, was taken into custody on Dec. 21 following a traffic stop in Cass County. A sheriff's deputy initially stopped Xiong for speeding, driving aggressively and weaving in and out of traffic on Interstate 80. //During a search of the vehicle, sheriff’s Sgt. Tyler Shiels found an AR-15 style rifle, which Xiong admitted to possessing beforehand, loaded magazines, boxes of ammunition, medical kits, body armor, food and cash, according to a six-page criminal complaint filed in the Southern District of Iowa and unsealed Wednesday.//'BOOMING' BIDEN ECONOMY? 'THE FIVE' BLAST LIBERAL MEDIA, DEMS FOR FLATTERING INFLATION COVERAGE//
      President Joe Biden delivers remarks on the debt ceiling during an event in the State Dining Room of the White House, Monday, Oct. 4 in Washington. 
      (AP Photo/Evan Vucci)// Xiong, a Merced resident, also had the White House address on a GPS device. Shiels said the vehicle looked very lived in" and that Xiong noted he had been fired from his job. He said he was traveling to "see things because it is unknown how long he has here on earth" and that a hotel in Washington D.C.
column8: would not be necessary. //He also made several statements
column9: including his "disapproval for government due to the sex abuse of children" and that cash was "ear marked" for funeral expenses. //He was taken into custody and then questioned by the U.S. Secret Service. Courts records said he "believes that he is the only person remaining who can free the United States of evil and it is necessary for him to kill those in positions of power."//"It is at this time XIONG began assembling the equipment needed to carry out his plan to kill those in power
column10:
Special Agent Justin Larson with the Secret Service wrote in the complaint.//
      Dr. Anthony Fauci, director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, speaks during the daily briefing at the White House in Washington on Dec. 1.
      (AP Photo/Susan Walsh, File)//The TikTok hit list" included 100 videos
column11: authorities said. Xiong said he would kill Biden unless he complied with his unspecified demands. His plan to get into the White House consisted of a "weak spot" he identified during research for his alleged attack. //He planned to use a grappling hook to climb over the perimeter fencing to gain access to the building in an effort to kill those on the list
column12: federal prosecutors said. //"When concluding the interview
column13: XIONG stated that nothing would stop him from carrying out his plan of gaining access to the White House and killing the persons on his ‘hit list
column14: ’" the complaint aid. "He added that if released from custody he would immediately resume traveling to the White House in Washington
column15: DC and ‘do whatever it takes’ to complete his plan."//"He further stated that he had no intention of returning to California to see his family because he plans on dying while fighting evil demons at the White House
column16:
the document added. //
      President Biden speaks during a Fourth of July event on the South Lawn of the White House in Washington, D.C.
      (Photographer: Sarah Silbiger/Bloomberg via Getty Images)//CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP//Xiong is charged with making criminal threats against a former president. He is scheduled to appear in court Thursday.

column1: Outgoing NIH director says 'hundreds of thousands would have died' from COVID if US hadn't listened to him

column1: Obama ethics chief calls Pelosi's support of lawmaker stock trading 'disgusting': the 'opposite’ of ethics
column2: "Senators selling stocks before the coronavirus pandemic rocked the markets have renewed attention on something called the STOCK Act. Here's what you need to know.//Senators selling stocks before the coronavirus pandemic rocked the markets have renewed attention on something called the STOCK Act. Here's what you need to know.//Former President Obama’s ethics chief called House Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s support of lawmakers trading stocks "disgusting" and the "opposite of government ethics."//Former director of the Office of Government Ethics (OGE) Walter Shaub torched the speaker’s backing of personal financial trading among lawmakers after Pelosi defended the practice Wednesday.//"We are a free market economy
column3: Pelosi, D-Calif., said, responding to a question about members of Congress and their spouses being barred from personal trading. They should be able to participate in that."//PELOSI SLAMS ‘ATTITUDE OF LAWLESSNESS’ IN SAN FRANCISCO
column4: SAYS ‘I DON’T KNOW’ WHERE IT COMES FROM//"What a disgusting comment
column5: Shaub told Fox News Digital in an email. This is the opposite of government ethics."//"Nobody kidnapped these members of Congress when they were private citizens
column6: dragged them to Washington and forced them to be in Congress
column7: Shaub added. The American people are sick of members of Congress buying and selling stock and creating the appearance of trading on insider information."//
